page.title: 19A schoolday in Cliffe
page.content: Nearly everybody walks or cycles to school, but some who live out of the village come by car. We can go into school or play out until the whistle goes at 9.00, then we read or choose some work until Assembly at 9.15. We spend the morning doing Maths or English, with a playtime at 10.45. Some days we watch school television programmes. On three days a week we have the computer in our class. A few go home for dinner, but most bring packed lunch or stay for school dinner. Then the boys play football or cricket, and a lot of girls play on roller skates until school starts again at 1.00 p.m. In the afternoons we do things like art, drama, games, sewing, craft, history, science, geography and music. Then at 3.30 we go home.
